image.title: CoinDesk: Bitcoin, Ethereum, Crypto News and Price Data

item.title: First Mover Asia: Bitcoin Falls on Inflation Fears but Continues Its Ride Above $17K
item.dc:creator: Sam Reynolds, James Rubin
item.description: ALSO: Sam Reynolds writes that Taiwan-based technology conglomerate HTC is looking to take its virtual headset business public as part of a quest to help cultivate the metaverse. But is the company going in the wrong direction?

media:content.media:description: Bitcoin continued to ride easily over $17K. (Marianna Lutkova/Unsplash)

item.title: Bitcoin Mining Difficulty Drops Most Since July 2021 as Crypto Winter Cuts Profitability
item.dc:creator: Eliza Gkritsi
item.description: Bitcoin miners are being caught between rising costs and the lower price of bitcoin.

media:content.media:description: Bitmain Antminer S19 Hydro mining rigs at a Merkle Standard facility in Washington state. (Eliza Gkritsi/CoinDesk)

item.title: Ether Turns Inflationary as Network Usage Slows
item.dc:creator: Jocelyn Yang
item.description: Ether's annualized inflation rate previously dropped below zero following the collapse of FTX-induced market volatility, which spurred a rise in Ethereum network usage. The positive inflation rate indicated ETH being minted outpaced being burned.

media:content.media:description: Chart shows Ether’s annualized inflation rate returned to a positive value after making a “V-shape” from November's market volatility triggered by FTX. (ultrasound.money)

item.title: DeFi Risk-Sharing Protocol Nexus Expects Loss on Maple Credit Pool Investment as FTX Contagion Widens
item.dc:creator: Krisztian Sandor
item.description: Nexus Mutual, which offers an insurance alternative for decentralized finance traders, deposited some $19 million in ETH to Maple’s wrapped ether credit pool, which was rocked by Orthogonal Trading’s recent default.

media:content.media:description: Nexus Mutual expects a loss of 2,461 ETH on its deposit into a wrapped ether credit pool on Maple Finance. (deepblue4you/Getty images)

item.title: Built With Bitcoin Foundation Opens New Technology Center in Ghana
item.dc:creator: Frederick Munawa
item.description: The structure was built by Ghanian workers compensated in bitcoin, on land donated by local communities.

item.title: Crypto Markets Today: FTX Fallout Hits Maple Finance; Bitcoin Declines
item.dc:creator: Jocelyn Yang
item.description: The cryptocurrency-focused financial services firm won an auction to buy the company from crypto lender Celsius, which filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection. Crypto Markets Today is CoinDesk’s daily newsletter diving into what happened in today's crypto markets.

item.title: Silvergate CEO Attempts to Address Concerns in Public Letter
item.dc:creator: Stephen Alpher
item.description: Shares of the crypto-focused bank have been reeling in part due to links with failed crypto exchange FTX and sister company Alameda Research.

item.title: Chainlink ‘Smart Money’ Might Be Pulling LINK Tokens Off Exchanges to Stake Them
item.dc:creator: Sage D. Young
item.description: The blockchain analysis firm Nansen says that some crypto traders appear to be withdrawing the LINK tokens en masse ahead of Tuesday’s opening for early access to Chainlink’s new staking program.

item.title: The Contagion Fever Breaks: NFTs Dominate Art Basel
item.dc:creator: Cam Thompson
item.description: The price of Ethereum is down nearly 65% since last year’s Miami Art Week. But this year’s global cultural phenomena saw an uptick in events, attendees and conversations around Web3 technologies and their roadmap to mass adoption.

media:content.media:description: NFT Gallery at Art Basel (Cam Thompson/CoinDesk)

item.title: Bitcoin Miner Riot Switches Mining Pool After Falling Short in November
item.dc:creator: Aoyon Ashraf
item.description: The miner used Braiins mining pool, which uses a payout method that caused the variance between Riot’s mining capacity and amount produced, according to a source

item.title: Kentucky Investigating 2 Proposed Contracts That Would Give Discounted Electricity to Crypto Miners
item.dc:creator: Nelson Wang
item.description: Kentucky’s Public Service Commission is concerned the rates could result in higher electric bills for state residents.

media:content.media:description: Kentucky is looking into proposed contracts that would give discounted electricity to crypto miners. (Getty Images)

item.title: Bankman-Fried Is a ‘Master of Deflection,’ Securities Lawyer Says
item.dc:creator: Fran Velasquez
item.description: James Murphy, founder of law firm Murphy & McGonigle, discusses the former FTX CEO’s attempt at side-stepping probing questions and whether lawmakers in the U.S. have enough evidence to move forward with a criminal trial.

media:content.media:description: Securities lawyer James A. Murphy says FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried will soon be facing criminal charges. (Murphy & McGonigle, P.C.)

item.title: Nexo to Depart US After Regulator Discussions Hit 'Dead End'
item.dc:creator: Nikhilesh De
item.description: Crypto lender Nexo announced Monday it would stop offering services to U.S. customers over the next several months, and would immediately suspend Earn access in eight states.

item.title: New FTX CEO Testimony ‘False,’ Bankman-Fried Says
item.dc:creator: Jack Schickler
item.description: FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried said documentation existed, despite John Ray bemoaning poor record keeping.

media:content.media:description: Former FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried (Jesse Hamilton/CoinDesk)

item.title: Crypto.com’s CRO Surges as It Launches World Cup NFTs With Coca-Cola
item.dc:creator: Lyllah Ledesma
item.description: 10,000 NFTs will be hosted on Crypto.com’s blockchain based on ‘heatmaps’ from World Cup matches.

item.title: Introducing Consensus Magazine: Putting Web3 in Perspective
item.dc:creator: Ben Schiller
item.description: Magazines are powerful when they spark dialogue about what’s happening now and could happen in the future. That’s Consensus all over, so we’re renaming Layer 2 after CoinDesk’s annual event.

item.title: Most Influential Artist: Adam Levine
item.dc:creator: Jessica Klein
item.description: The artist made a portrait of crypto critic Molly White, and went down the Web3 rabbit hole she opened up.

item.title: FTX Contagion Spreads as Orthogonal Trading Gets Default Notice for $36M Debt on Maple Finance
item.dc:creator: Krisztian Sandor
item.description: Orthogonal Trading was due to pay back a $10 million USDC stablecoin loan on Dec. 4.

media:content.media:description: Crypto hedge fund Orthogonal Trading appears to be the next firm becoming insolvent after crypto exchange FTX's implosion. (Tom Wilson/Unsplash)

item.title: Most Influential Artist: Osinachi
item.dc:creator: Jessica Klein
item.description: The Nigerian artist creates one-of-a-kind images using Microsoft Word. For this season, he depicted Mikhaylo Federov, the Ukrainian official who raised about $200 million in crypto for that country's war effort.

item.title: Most Influential Artist: Ravi Vora
item.dc:creator: Jessica Klein

item.title: Most Influential Artist: Sarah Script
item.dc:creator: Jessica Klein

item.title: Aave’s Social Media Protocol Lens Acquires NFT Mobile Game Sonar
item.dc:creator: Xinyi Luo
item.description: With the acquisition, Lens Protocol will be integrated into a game app which claims to have 20,000 active users per month.

item.title: Most Influential Artist: Federico Solmi
item.dc:creator: Jessica Klein
item.description: The Italian artist, a resident of New York City, created a 3D image of Vitalik Buterin and the Ethereum developers for their role orchestrating The Merge, the most consequential upgrade in blockchain history.

item.title: The Artist and Technology Behind 36 AI Portraits
item.dc:creator: Xinyi Luo
item.description: How to generate three dozen portraits for the Most Influential 2022 in about a week? Meet Will Ess and Pixelmind.ai, the app that saved this CoinDesk feature from visual ennui.

media:content.media:description: Will Ess and Adam Levine of 330AI (Will Ess for Pixelmind.ai/CoinDesk)

item.title: Crypto Bank Silvergate Cut to Underweight at Morgan Stanley Following FTX Collapse
item.dc:creator: Will Canny
item.description: Already down more than 50% over the past month, the bank’s shares are lower by another 3% in premarket action Monday morning.

media:content.media:description: Morgan Stanley downgrades its rating on crypto bank Silvergate Capital's shares to underweight from equal weight. (Unsplash)

item.title: Malta Seeks to Remove NFTs From Crypto Law
item.dc:creator: Jack Schickler
item.description: The move anticipates new EU legislation by excluding non-fungible assets.

item.title: Waves Blockchain Founder Explores New DAO Model to Improve Crypto Governance
item.dc:creator: Shaurya Malwa
item.description: The model is designed to add accountability by introducing performance measures, rewards and penalties.

media:content.media:description: Power Protocol is designed to improve governance of decentralized organizations. (Shutterstock)

item.title: CoinDesk Got Colorful With the Most Influential 2022 NFT Collection
item.dc:creator: Sam Ewen
item.description: For the fourth year, CoinDesk has partnered with 14 artists to immortalize on-chain some of the Most Influential 2022, whose NFT portraits will be made available in an exclusive auction being held on Coinbase NFT.

item.title: Most Influential Artist: Dave Krugman
item.dc:creator: Jessica Klein
item.description: The photographer captured his portrait of Erick Calderon at a Bright Moments NFT art event in Mexico City.

item.title: Most Influential Artist: Bryan Brinkman
item.dc:creator: Jessica Klein
item.description: The Dubai animator tries to display the mystery of Razzlekhan and Lichtenstein, the beginning of this year’s decent into fraud and deception.

item.title: Most Influential Artist: Trevor and Violet Jones
item.dc:creator: Jessica Klein
item.description: The artist couple collaborated for the first time ever on their painting of Alexey Pertsev, the developer arrested for his role in creating Tornado Cash.

item.title: Most Influential Artist: Alex Headlam (Aleqth)
item.dc:creator: Jessica Klein
item.description: The artist sought inspiration from Andy Warhol and Tim Burton to create his portrait of Binance’s CEO Changpeng Zhao, known as CZ.

item.title: Most Influential Artist: Fesq
item.dc:creator: Jessica Klein
item.description: The previous programmer creates an image called “The Maestro,” which ties Yat Siu’s music background to his position as a leader in the gaming and blockchain industry.

item.title: Most Influential Artist: Yosnier
item.dc:creator: Jessica Klein
item.description: A 23-year-old artist doesn’t want to come across as sympathizing with Sam Bankman-Fried, who lost numerous people’s life savings in FTX's collapse.

item.title: Most Influential Artist: Norman Harman
item.dc:creator: Jessica Klein
item.description: The Edinburgh-based artist use a combination of technologies and brick-and-mortar traditional values to draw Nirmala Sitharaman, India’s Minister of Finance and Corporate Affairs for this year’s Most Influential list.

item.title: Most Influential Artist: Oveck
item.dc:creator: Jessica Klein
item.description: The New York-based artist depicted one of the year's NFT success stories – Yuga Labs, the company behind the Bored Ape phenom – for CoinDesk's Most Influential series.

item.title: Most Influential Artist: Ovie Faruq
item.dc:creator: Jessica Klein
item.description: The NFT artist sought to depict the "carelessness and neglect" of the "Four Horsemen of the Cryptocalypse" in his NFT art for CoinDesk's Most Influential 2022.

item.title: First Mover Americas: Axie Infinity's Token Takes Off
item.dc:creator: Lyllah Ledesma, Omkar Godbole
item.description: The latest price moves in bitcoin (BTC) and crypto markets in context for Dec. 5, 2022. First Mover is CoinDesk’s daily newsletter that contextualizes the latest actions in the crypto markets.

item.title: He Put a Magnifying Glass on Terra and It Went Up in Flames
item.dc:creator: Sam Reynolds
item.description: Having whistleblowers’ trust made a cranky pseudonymous Twitter account key to the flameout of Terraform Labs and its LUNA token. That’s why FatManTerra is one of CoinDesk’s Most Influential 2022.

item.title: Now That He Has the Power to Make His Crypto Dreams Come True, Will He?
item.dc:creator: Sandali Handagama
item.description: As finance minister earlier this year he backed measures for regulating stablecoins and boldly declared he would turn the U.K. into an international hub for crypto. Now he’s prime minister and an FTX-scarred industry is watching. That’s why Rishi Sunak is one of CoinDesk’s Most Influential 2022.

item.title: The Members of Congress Who Have Stablecoin Issuers Watching Their Next Moves
item.dc:creator: Jesse Hamilton
item.description: Anticipation for a crypto bill out of the House Financial Services Committee ran so high this year that stablecoin issuers have been trying to meet the bill’s expected standards before the rules are even set. That’s why Rep. Maxine Waters and Rep. Patrick McHenry are two of CoinDesk’s Most Influential 2022.

media:content.media:description: Maxine Waters and Patrick McHenry (Will Ess for Pixelmind.ai/CoinDesk)

item.title: Guiding the Chinese Central Bank Digital Currency the World Admires and Fears
item.dc:creator: Xinyi Luo
item.description: Many nations, especially the economic superpowers, began the year in fear of being left behind by China’s relentless progress with its digital yuan. For leading the development of the most advanced major CBDC, Mu Changchun is one of CoinDesk’s Most Influential 2022.

item.title: Left Behind by the Merge, but Still Fighting
item.dc:creator: Sienna Park
item.description: The spectacular success of the Merge obscured the stories of those who were left behind, the Ethereum proof-of-work miners who lost their livelihoods. One miner is not letting the crypto community ignore them. That’s why Chandler Guo is one of CoinDesk’s Most Influential 2022.

item.title: The OG Streetwear Designer Fighting for NFT Creator Royalties
item.dc:creator: Doreen Wang
item.description: When 20-year-old streetwear brand The Hundreds jumped into Web3 last year, its loyal fans spent upwards of $100 million on its NFTs. This year it canceled its OpenSea drop in a principled stand for creators’ financial interests. That’s why Bobby “The Hundreds” Kim is one of CoinDesk’s Most Influential 2022.

item.title: Blending the World’s Most Successful Loyalty Program With Web3
item.dc:creator: Xinyi Luo
item.description: The brains behind Starbucks Rewards, which now counts 60 million members worldwide, is back to design Starbucks Odyssey, a Web3 loyalty program. That's why Adam Brotman is one of CoinDesk’s Most Influential 2022.

item.title: The Teen Dropping $20M in NFTs
item.dc:creator: Cam Thompson
item.description: Following his breakout year as an NFT artist, this 19-year old sold a generative art collection of "paint drop" NFTs for $20 million. That’s why FEWOCiOUS is one of CoinDesk’s Most Influential 2022.

media:content.media:description: Victor Langlois aka FEWOCiOUS (Will Ess for Pixelmind.ai/CoinDesk)

item.title: Miladys NFT Community Is the Counterculture to Cancel Culture
item.dc:creator: Marc Hochstein
item.description: The uncanny, anime-inspired, profile pictures invite conversations about whether the sins of the creator are laid upon the creation. That’s why the Miladys NFT community is one of CoinDesk’s Most Influential 2022.

item.title: The Organizer of the Freedom Convoy Who Got Its Crypto Assets Frozen
item.dc:creator: Frederick Munawa
item.description: Canada’s trucker protest organizers unwittingly taught us that a private citizen in that country can successfully petition a judge to freeze someone else’s crypto. That's why Tamara Lich is one of CoinDesk’s Most Influential 2022.

item.title: Don’t Let the Neckwear Fool You
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Napolitano
item.description: This anonymous account has been converting TradFi Toms into crypto bros. That’s why BowTied Bull is one of CoinDesk’s Most Influential 2022.

item.title: Stablecoin Issuer Circle Cancels Plan to Go Public
item.dc:creator: Parikshit Mishra, Jamie Crawley
item.description: The firm had announced plans to go public in July of 2021.

media:content.media:description: Circle Chief Strategy Officer Dante Disparte (left) and CEO Jeremy Allaire (Nikhilesh De/CoinDesk)
